definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Coupling between Tropospheric and Stratospheric Leading Modes.
sentences.chinese: 对流层和平流层主要模态之间的耦合。

sentences.english: It gives way to the whitish stratosphere and then into the mesosphere.
sentences.chinese: 在它之外是发白的平流层，然后是进入散逸层。

sentences.english: Debris injected during the autumn into the lower polar stratosphere may have a half-residence time of as little as 3 months.
sentences.chinese: 在秋季间进入低区平流层的碎片半停留期只有3个月。

sentences.english: Generation Mechanisms of Convectively Forced Internal Gravity Waves and Their Propagation to the Stratosphere.
sentences.chinese: 对流强迫重力内波的生成机制和向平流层的传播。

sentences.english: The findings will trigger a radical rethink about the state of the stratosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些发现将引发对平流层状态大量的重新思考。

sentences.english: GCM Study of Volcanic Eruptions as a Cause of Increased Stratospheric Water Vapor.
sentences.chinese: 用GCM研究火山喷发作为平流层水气增加的原因。

sentences.english: The paper also suggests that reverse C-band could be used in developing HAPS's Chinese version.
sentences.chinese: 建议利用反向C频段开发我国的平流层通信系统。

sentences.english: Above the stratosphere is the stratopause.

definition: Titan (moon of Saturn), aka Saturn VI
